title: Easy2boot eset sysrescue 0x0000007B error on boot

forumNotes.author: kart3
forumNotes.content:
I prepared easy2boot usb pendrive, parted magic is ooting OK, but when i try to boot sys rescue iso created with eset sys rescue (it is generally windows PE 2 or 3 environment) it shows error 0x0000007b BSOD.

How can i fix it?

It is the same on quemu and on physical computer, with or without mass storage DPMS drivers.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Did you try renaming the ISO as .isoask and then trying the various different options (e.g. .isoPE01)?

forumNotes.author: kart3
forumNotes.content:
Yes, renamed file to eav.iso

tested most of option, loaded into memory, but result is every time the same - 0x0000007b

forumNotes.author: kart3
forumNotes.content:
\^eav.isoask of course

**Edited by kart3, 04 October 2013 - 11:36 AM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
I can't seem to install eset on my system so I can't make an ISO and test it any more!

Can you private mail me a link to your ISO?

forumNotes.author: kart3
forumNotes.content: Ok. I will PM you in few minutes.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
hmm - the ISO is a flat file image of WinPE. So it cannot be booted from an ISO. ![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif)

Even if you extract the files, it won't boot because the BCD has been set to boot from the UUID of the 'CD'.

Here is how to get a flat boot working.

1. Extact the whole ISO to the root of the E2B drive

2. Run EasyBCD - File - Select BCD Store - (select e2B \\boot\\bcd file)

and **Add New Entry** for Portable/External Media

Type: Extracted FilesSystem

Name: ESA Rescue

Drive: (drive letter of e2B drive)

EMS Enabled (unticked)

-\>\> Add Entry

3. Edit Boot Menu - set new entry as the first entry (set a countdown if you like or 'wait for user selection')

4. Save Settings

5. Make a new .mnu file

```
title ESA Rescue (Flat File) \n Boots directly from files on drive
chainloader /bootmgr
```

HTH

Steve

P.S. Under Advanced Menu, change the drive letter to BOOT so it can boot on other systems.

P.P.S. Although this boots fine under a VM (with the USB drive as HDD0), I get 7B crash on real systems. Even running bcdboot to add a WinPE entry to the BCD does not work!

**Edited by steve6375, 04 October 2013 - 03:06 PM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
GENA is PE 1, so try .isowinv

Does winbuilder ISo have \\sources\\install.wim file? If so it should work...

forumNotes.author: kart3
forumNotes.content: Thanks, unfortunatelly there is no .wim file inside this iso, and it wont boot on winv extension, the same error 0x0000007b

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Sorry! I meant boot.wim not install.wim. If no wim at all then it must be a flat file too.

You need to follow same procedure as for eset.

forumNotes.author: kart3
forumNotes.content: Ok, thanks:)

forumNotes.author: kart3
forumNotes.content:
One more thing.

If flat iso does not work, how should i create iso that will work fine?

or img, or iso, i would prefer that this live cd would be in one file rather than extracted.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
You could use imagex to make a boot.wim file from the extracted ISO files.

Then make (using MS WAIK) or find an exisiting ramdrive winpe ISO and replace \\sources\\boot.wim with your new one.

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> If flat iso does not work, how should i create iso that will work fine?
How do you build the SysRescue ISO image?  
Do you set RAM 576 MB or up at build time?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
You can re-build the ISO as a WinPE boot.wim file 1. Find a bootable WinPE ISO or project that has a \\sources\\boot.wim file. We need to copy the whole \\boot folder from this. We need the BCD file (for WinPE ram booting) and boot.sdi file (and maybe the font files). 2. Extract the SysRescue ISO files to an empty folder (say SR) using 7Zip 3. Delete the contents of the SR\\BOOT folder and delete the \[BOOT\] folder if present. Make a boot.wim file using imageX as follows imagex /boot /capture C:\\SR C:\\temp\\boot.wim "My new wim file" copy the boot.wim file to C:\\SR\\SOURCES\\boot.wim 4. Copy the contents of the WinPE BOOT folder found in Step 1 to the SR folder (SR\\BOOT\\BCD and SR\\BOOT\\boot.sdi should now be present) 5. Make sure you have the bootmgr file in the SR folder \\bootmgr \\boot\\bcd \\boot\\boot.sdi \\boot\\font folder \\sources\\boot.wim At this point you could use oscdimg to make a bootable ISO, however I used my tools and a spare USB drive as follows. 1. Use RMPrepUSB to format a WinPE/BOOTMGR bootable FAT32 USB flash drive 2. Copy the contents of the SR folder to the root of the flash drive ~~3. Install grub4dos to the MBR and grldr~~ ~~4. Make a \\menu.lst file with~~ ``` chainloader /bootmgr ``` ~~in it~~ ~~5. Use **RMPrepUSB - F11** to boot it to QEMU and make sure it boots correctly (or boot it on a real system or VBox)~~ ~~6. Use the **RMPrepUSB - File - Make grub4dos ISO from Drive (Ctrl+M)** to make a bootable ISO file~~ Of course, the ISO will need at least 512MB+ of memory to boot in, whereas the old flat-file ISO would not have needed anywhere near as much (which is presumably why it was made like this - they needed the flat file structure for low-RAM systems). P.S. When using ImageX in Step 3 - make sure you specify /boot - this is most important! Note: Step 6 does not make a bootable winpe ISO. Instead, omit steps 3-6 and instead use the command oscdimg -n -m -o -bh:\\boot\\etfsboot.com h:\\ z:\\temp\\eva.iso to make the ISO Note that H:\\boot\\etfsboot.com does not need to be on your USB stick, it can be anywhere.
**Edited by steve6375, 05 October 2013 - 03:18 PM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: hmmm - just tried this and it all worked until step 6 after making the ISO. The ISO does not boot fully and fails with a '\\Boot\\BCD 0xc000000f an error occurred while attempting to read the BCD'.. ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
The ISO boots if you use oscdimg to make the ISO and use the etfsboot.com file.

```
oscdimg -n -m -o -bc:\pe86\etfsboot.com c:\pe86\ISO c:\pe86\winpexp.iso
```

I will ammend the instructions.

P.S. A good source for the \\boot\\bcd and boot.sdi and etfsboot.com is the Win7 Install ISO.

forumNotes.content: thank you:)
